title: Diamond Resorts International(R) -- Vacations for Life(R) -- Relax in the Heart of the Colorado Rocky Mountains
text:
October 15, 2015 06:47 ET Diamond Resorts International® -- Vacations for Life® -- Relax in the Heart of the Colorado Rocky Mountains 
LAS VEGAS, NV --(Marketwired - October 15, 2015) - Visiting the Diamond Resorts International® Historic Crags Lodge in Estes Park, Colorado, is like taking a journey back in time into the last century. The forest lodge is a quaint retreat that is sure to stir the soul of any nature lover. It boasts a well-maintained, rustically historic charm, yet includes all the modern amenities to make a vacation trip smooth and comfortable. The lodge first opened its doors to the public on the Fourth of July, 1914, and was founded by brothers Joe and Enos Mills, who were instrumental in establishing the famous 415-square mile Rocky Mountain National Park, whose border begins only twelve miles away. 
The area, known as "The Gateway to the Rockies," is largely unchanged from the wilderness of a hundred years ago with elk, deer, bighorn sheep, black bear, and other impressive wildlife roaming the backwoods. Especially adventurous travelers will be thrilled about the great variety of year-round activities they can choose from: skiing, sledding, and snowboarding in the winter; rock climbing, fishing, hiking, biking, and horseback riding during the warmer months. Water sports abound, with options for every preference, whether it's the thrill of water skiing, wakeboarding, or white water rafting -- or something a little more serene, like canoeing, kayaking, or simply float-tubing. Every member of the family can find something they'll love to do -- whether as a group or individually. 
While a rich paradise for the avid outdoorsperson, the town of Estes Park is also a visitor draw. Guests at Diamond Resorts International® The Historic Crags Lodge can enjoy a range of restaurants and shops as well as seasonal festivals that are rich with the region's cultural heritage. The lodge itself is a balance of affordable luxury and comfort with a choice of studios, one-, or two-bedrooms that include a queen-size bed, sleeper sofa, and a modern bathroom. Rooms feature a range of amenities including a fully equipped kitchen, flat screen TV with cable and DVD/VCR player. Complimentary laundry facilities make your stay at Diamond Resorts International® The Historic Crags Lodge as comfortable as home, to help you Stay Vacationed™. 
About Diamond Resorts International® 
Diamond Resorts International®, with its network of more than 330 vacation destinations located in 34 countries throughout the continental United States, Hawaii, Canada, Mexico, the Caribbean, South America, Central America, Europe, Asia, Australasia and Africa, provides guests with choice and flexibility to let them create their dream vacation, whether they are traveling an hour away or around the world. Our relaxing vacations have the power to give guests an increased sense of happiness and satisfaction in their lives, while feeling healthier and more fulfilled in their relationships, by enjoying memorable and meaningful experiences that let them Stay Vacationed™. 
Diamond Resorts International® manages vacation ownership resorts and sells vacation ownership points that provide members and owners with Vacations for Life® at over 330 managed and affiliated properties and cruise itineraries. 
To learn more, visit: https://www.diamondresorts.com/The-Historic-Crags-Lodge .
